RNBW ดิ่งลงต่ำกว่าราคา ICO ถึง 65% ในวันแรกที่เปิดซื้อขาย

RNBW Tanks 65% Below ICO Price on First Day of Trading

4h ago//Denis Omelchenko
general
AI

Summary

TH

เหรียญ RNBW ของวอลเล็ต Rainbow ดิ่งลงเกิน 65% จากราคา ICO ในวันแรกที่เปิดซื้อขาย โดยประสบปัญหาทางเทคนิคและสภาพตลาดที่ไม่เอื้ออำนวย หลังจากเปิดตัวบนเครือข่าย Base เหรียญดังกล่าวเคยพุ่งขึ้นสูงสุดที่ $0.05 แต่ร่วงลงมาอยู่ที่ราว $0.032 ส่งผลให้มูลค่า FDV อยู่ที่ประมาณ $32 ล้าน การเคลื่อนไหวของราคานี้ทำให้ผู้เข้าร่วม ICO ซึ่งซื้อเหรียญที่ราคา $0.10 ผ่าน CoinList ในช่วงกลางเดือนธันวาคม ต้องเผชิญกับความสูญเสียอย่างหนัก ขณะที่นักลงทุนในสหรัฐฯ ยังต้องรอรับการปลดล็อกเหรียญเพิ่มเติมอีกด้วย การเปิดตัวครั้งนี้ถูกคร่ำครึมด้วยปัญหาการจ่ายเหรียญล่าช้าเนื่องจากระบบ backend ที่รองรับไม่ไหว ก่อให้เกิดความไม่พอใจในหมู่นักลงทุนและผู้มีสิทธิ์รับ airdrop แม้ว่าตลาดคริปโตโดยรวมจะอยู่ในภาวะตกต่ำและ Bitcoin ร่วงลงสู่ระดับ $60,000 แต่ Alex LaPrade CEO ของ Rainbow ยังคงปกป้องการเลือกเวลาในการจัดงาน Token Generation Event (TGE) อย่างไรก็ตาม คำอธิบายดังกล่าวไม่สามารถปลอบใจนักลงทุนทุกคนได้ โดยบางส่วนได้ออกมาวิพากษ์วิจารณ์ว่าโปรเจกต์นี้เป็นการหลอกลวงและเรียกร้องให้มีการคืนเงิน

EN

Rainbow wallet’s native token RNBW plummeted over 65% below its ICO price on its first day of trading, marred by technical issues and a harsh market environment. After debuting on the Base network, the token hit a high of $0.05 but quickly fell to around $0.032, resulting in a fully diluted valuation (FDV) of roughly $32 million. This price action left ICO participants, who purchased tokens at $0.10 via CoinList in mid-December, facing significant losses, with U.S. investors facing additional waiting periods for token unlocks. The launch was plagued by delayed token distribution attributed to an overwhelmed backend token indexer, causing frustration among investors and airdrop recipients. Despite the broader market downturn that wiped out billions in liquidations and pushed Bitcoin toward $60,000, Rainbow CEO Alex LaPrade defended the timing of the Token Generation Event (TGE). However, the failed to appease all investors, many of whom took to social media to accuse the project of being a scam and demand refunds.

Key Points

  • RNBW token fell over 65% below its $0.10 ICO price on the first day of trading.
  • Technical issues with the backend token indexer caused delayed distributions for investors and airdrop recipients.
  • The token is currently trading around $0.032 with an FDV of approximately $32 million.
  • The launch occurred during a broader market downturn, with Bitcoin sliding toward $60,000.
  • Frustrated investors accused the project of being a scam and demanded refunds on social media.

Article

The launch was plagued by reports of delayed token distribution to early investors and technical issues. Self-custodial Ethereum wallet Rainbow debuted its native token RNBW yesterday, Feb. 5. But the project’s token generation event (TGE) on Base , and the token’s debut for trading across exchanges, were met with reports of delayed distribution to ICO participants, which contributed to the token’s poor day-one performance. RNBW/USD 15-minute chart, Feb. 5-6. Source: Coinbase According to Coinbase data , RNBW hit a high of $0.05 on its first day of trading, but fell quickly and closed the daily session around $0.034, down more than 30%, putting its fully diluted valuation around $34 million. That left most bettors on Polymarket scrambling , having expected the FDV to hit roughly $100 million just a day after the TGE. Today, RNBW fell further, trading around $0.032 by press time, making its FDV around $32.17 million. ICO Investors in the Red The price is far below what early buyers paid. Rainbow conducted its initial coin offering (ICO) in mid-December 2025 via CoinList, where investors were offered RNBW at $0.1 per token. The sale saw 30 million RNBW tokens, or 3% of total supply, sold at an FDV of $100 million, meaning participants in that sale are now down more than 65% on their investments. For U.S. investors, the situation could be even worse as their full token unlock won’t happen until December of this year, according to CoinList’s terms and conditions. Back in 2022, Rainbow raised $18 million in a Series A funding round led by Seven Seven Six, the VC firm from Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian, bringing total funding to $21 million. The multi-chain wallet is known for its rewards program and gamification, where users can earn points for their on-chain activity. The firm explicitly connected RNBW with its points system when it first announced the token in September, and later specified that users who earned points in the wallet were eligible for a token airdrop. ‘No Better Day for TGE’ The token’s drop came amid a broader market bloodbath that wiped out $2.6 billion in liquidations in a single day. Total crypto market capitalization fell to $2.3 trillion as Bitcoin slid toward $60,000, reaching roughly 50% below its all-time high of $126,080, set in October. Soon after its TGE, Rainbow’s cofounder Mike Demarais indicated in an X post that some users had not received their claimed tokens, explaining “it’s because our backend token indexer has been getting slammed.” As frustration over the messy launch mounted, Rainbow CEO Alex LaPrade took to X on Thursday evening eastern time to say he still believes “there was no better day for TGE than today,” noting that the project had planned to launch its token on Feb. 5 back in December. LaPrade added: “TGE isn’t the finish line. Having a token live in market brings more scrutiny — both positive and negative.” But the CEO’s public statement didn’t succeed in calming all investors. Some quickly fired back at the CEO, accusing the project of late token distribution to CoinList pre-sale participants, as well as to points earners, calling it a scam and demanding refunds. Last year, MetaMask confirmed that it has plans to launch its own token, after years of hinting and speculation .
